alert.note: Alert for Arco, Mud Lake Desert; Eastern Magic Valley; Lower Snake River Plain; Raft River Region; Shoshone, Lava Beds; Southern Hills, Albion Mountains; Wood River Foothills (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 02 at 5:51AM MDT by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...LOCALIZED PATCHES OF DENSE FOG CONTINUE EARLY THIS MORNING ACROSS PORTIONS OF THE EASTERN MAGIC VALLEY, RAFT RIVER REGION, LOWER SNAKE RIVER PLAIN, ARCO DESERT, AND SOUTHERN WOOD RIVER VALLEY... At 550 AM...Area weather stations, webcams, satellite, and spotter reports were continuing to monitor pockets of dense fog. While the fog is not widespread, visibility in these pockets ranged from one mile to as low as one-tenth of a mile. The most persistent trouble spots have included, but are not limited to, the interchange of Interstate 84 and Interstate 86, Conner Summit, near and just west of Pocatello Regional Airport, just north of Blackfoot along Interstate 15, and over Idaho National Laboratory. Fog has also expanded into the southern Wood River Valley. Model guidance suggests fog will continue this morning, slowly diminishing between 9 AM and 11 AM. Anyone traveling or commuting across the eastern Magic Valley, Raft River Region, lower Snake River Plain, Arco Desert, and southern Wood River Valley this morning should be prepared to suddenly encounter dense fog. When entering fog, slow down, use extreme caution, switch to low beam headlights if possible, and use painted roadway lines to help guide you.

area.areaDesc: Arco, Mud Lake Desert; Eastern Magic Valley; Lower Snake River Plain; Raft River Region; Shoshone, Lava Beds; Southern Hills, Albion Mountains; Wood River Foothills
